Hi <@U05G4NXML04>, you can use the SV sponsor to scan url your system and view the latest round, similar to how public RPC displays the latest block heights. Simply use your provider_party ID to fetch the most recent round number.

text:
Hi <!here>

I'm onboarding on our mainnet and got this issue:

```Insufficient funds to buy configured traffic amount. Please ensure that the validator's wallet has enough amulets to purchase 1.2 MB of traffic to continue healthy operation.```
I don't get this issue on devnet/testnet and it works out of the box.

But probably on mainnet we require real token and some initial top-up? Anyone know how to do so ?

My party id is

```fivenorth-mainnet1-1::12208a2c7404062865085b75b9e8a3cbca56f272c0103bc55b0e65ca7c2dd855294a```

```curl -X POST -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data-raw "{\"party_id\":\"$PARTY_ID\",\"name\":\"$USER\"}" \
<https://wallet.validator.mainnet.fivenorth.io/api/validator/v0/admin/users>```
And it returns

```{
  "error": "Traffic balance below reserved traffic amount (0 < 200000)"
}```
